verses.text: And an angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came up from Gilgal to Bochim , and said , I made you to go up out of Egypt , and have brought you unto the land which I sware unto your fathers ; and I said , I will never break my covenant with you.\f + \fr 2.1 \ft angel: or, messenger\f*
And ye shall make no league with the inhabitants of this land ; ye shall throw down their altars : but ye have not obeyed my voice : why have ye done this?
Wherefore I also said , I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be \add as thorns\add* in your sides , and their gods shall be a snare unto you.
And it came to pass, when the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake these words unto all the children of Israel , that the people lifted up their voice , and wept.
And they called the name of that place Bochim : and they sacrificed there unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 2.5 \ft Bochim: that is, Weepers\f* \p
¶ And when Joshua had let the people go , the children of Israel went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.

And the people served the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* all the days of Joshua , and all the days of the elders that outlived Joshua , who had seen all the great works of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, that he did for Israel.  +  r 2.7  t outlived: Heb. prolonged days after *
And Joshua the son of Nun , the servant of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, died , \add being\add* an hundred and ten years old.
And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath-heres , in the mount of Ephraim , on the north side of the hill Gaash.\f + \fr 2.9 \ft Timnath-heres: also called, Timnath-serah\f*

And also all that generation were gathered unto their fathers : and there arose another generation after them, which knew not the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, nor yet the works which he had done for Israel. \p
¶ And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and served Baalim :

And they forsook the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of their fathers , which brought them out of the land of Egypt , and followed other gods , of the gods of the people that \add were\add* round about them, and bowed themselves unto them, and provoked the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* to anger.
And they forsook the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and served Baal and Ashtaroth. \p

¶ And the anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was hot against Israel , and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers that spoiled them, and he sold them into the hands of their enemies round about , so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.

Whithersoever they went out , the hand of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was against them for evil , as the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had said , and as the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had sworn unto them: and they were greatly distressed. \p
¶ Nevertheless the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* raised up judges , which delivered them out of the hand of those that spoiled them.\f + \fr 2.16 \ft delivered: Heb. saved\f*

And yet they would not hearken unto their judges , but they went a whoring after other gods , and bowed themselves unto them: they turned quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in , obeying the commandments of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; \add but\add* they did not so.

And when the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* raised them up judges , then the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was with the judge , and delivered them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge : for it repented the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* because of their groanings by reason of them that oppressed them and vexed them.

And it came to pass, when the judge was dead , \add that\add* they returned , and corrupted \add themselves\add* more than their fathers , in following other gods to serve them, and to bow down unto them; they ceased not from their own doings , nor from their stubborn way.\f + \fr 2.19 \ft corrupted…: or, were corrupt\f*\f + \fr 2.19 \ft ceased…: Heb. let nothing fall of their\f* \p

¶ And the anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was hot against Israel ; and he said , Because that this people hath transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers , and have not hearkened unto my voice ;
I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the nations which Joshua left when he died :
That through them I may prove Israel , whether they will keep the way of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to walk therein, as their fathers did keep \add it\add*, or not.
Therefore the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* left those nations , without driving them out hastily ; neither delivered he them into the hand of Joshua.\f + \fr 2.23 \ft left: or, suffered\f*
